headline: Winooski superintendent testifies in DC, sues DHS for detainment and harassment by immigration authorities
summary: Winooski Superintendent Wilmer Chavarria testified before Congress on Dec. 9 about his July detention by CBP agents in Houston. He filed a lawsuit against DHS alleging Fourth Amendment violations for warrantless searches of his electronic devices and denial of legal counsel. His testimony highlighted the Trump administration's mass deportation campaign's impact on citizens. DHS defended its border inspection policies as necessary for combating serious crimes. Sen. Peter Welch introduced Chavarria to emphasize the distinction between targeting criminals and detaining law-abiding immigrants and citizens.
